 run ()

Detailed Description

TestModule class. Defines the properties of a single module and provides a run method to run the tests in this module.
Author:
Bas van Gaalen
Since:
1.0

Definition at line 12 of file TestModule.class.php.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TestModule.__construct ( $  sTitle = '',
$  sProtocol = '',
$  sServer = '',
$  iPort = 0,
$  sEmail = '',
$  bEmailOnError = false,
$  sFile = '',
$  bFileOnError = false 
)

Constructor initializes the module.

Parameters:
$sTitle string Module title
$sProtocol string Protocol to use when setting up socket connection (http/https).
$sServer string Server's domain name.
$iPort int Port number to connect to on server.
$sEmail string Email address to mail report to.
$bEmailOnError bool If true, only send emails in case of an error in the report.
$sFile string Filename to write report to.
$bFileOnError bool IF true, only write to module log in case of an error in the report.
Since:
1.0

Here is the caller graph for this function:

TestModule.run (  ) 

Run the tests in this module. Calls the run method in the TestItem classes that are defined in this module. Also takes care of logging to screen, mail and/or file.

Since:
1.0
